StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genomic Psychiatry Cohort (GPC) Whole Genome Sequencing Pilot Study

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AT ANN ARBOR

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: “The Institute for Genomic Health at the SUNY Downstate Health Science University (Downstate) and an extensive network of academic medical centers have created the Genomic Psychiatry Cohort (GPC). The GPC consists of a large clinical cohort of patients with schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, OCD, family members and healthy controls. Genomic characterization, including genotyping and sequencing of GPC participants has been done in collaboration with Downstate and the Stanley Center for Psychiatric Research at the Broad Institute. The following statement should be used for all analyses resulting from this dataset: “The Genome Psychiatry Cohort sample ascertainment was supported by NIH grants MH085548 and MH085542 and the Stanley Center for Psychiatric Research at the Broad Institute. The whole genome sequencing of the GPC study was supported by NHGRI grant 5U54HG003067, a philanthropic gift to the Stanley Center for Psychiatric Research, and NIH grants MH086873 and MH085548, as well as, U01MH105653(Boehnke), U01MH105573(Patos), and U01MH105641(McCarroll).”

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Schizophrenia and related disorders)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-SZRD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Schizophrenia and related disorders.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Bipolar Disorder)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-BPD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Bipolar Disorder.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

StudyTo.name: dbGaP Collection: Compilation of Individual-Level Genomic Data for General Research Use

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genomic Psychiatry Cohort (GPC) Whole Genome Sequencing Pilot Study

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The Center for Genomic Psychiatry at the University of Southern California (USC) and an extensive network of academic medical centers have created the Genomic Psychiatry Cohort (GPC). The GPC consists of a large clinical cohort of patients with schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and healthy controls. The pilot phase of whole genome sequencing of the GPC has been done in collaboration with the USC and the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard. The following statement should be used for all analyses resulting from this dataset: “The Genome Psychiatry Cohort sample ascertainment was supported by NIH grants MH085548 and MH085542 and the Stanley Medical Research Institute. The whole genome sequencing of the GPC pilot study was supported by NHGRI grant 5U54HG003067, a philanthropic gift to the Stanley Center for Psychiatric Research, and NIH grants MH086873 and MH085548.”

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Schizophrenia and related disorders)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-SZRD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Schizophrenia and related disorders.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Bipolar Disorder)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-BPD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Bipolar Disorder.
